intro: Cancrinia paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, pale blue or white flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. It is often found in coastal dunes and is a member of the Geraniaceae family. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
